page.title: 04HUMBER ESTUARY-WILDLIFE
page.content: { RIVER BED}The bed of the Humber is very muddy,mainly consisting of silt brought down from inland or washed out from the clay cliffs of Holderness. Many creatures live in this mud including Marine Worms,Shrimps,Shell- fish (Tellins,Cockles,Mussels)and Crabs and some plants live on the tidal fringes. {VEGETATION-SALTMARSH}These plants include Sea Spurrey,Sea Blite,Sea purslane,Sea Milkwort,GlassWort or Samphire,Scurvy Grass,Cord Grass,Sea Meadow Grass,Red Fescue Grass,Eelgrass Sea Aster,Sea Lavender,Sea Plantain, Sea Arrow Grass,and Thrift. {BIRD VISITORS }include Geese, Comerants,Shelducks,Curlew,Bar-tailed Godwit,Grey Plover,Red Shank,Knot, Turnstone,Dunlin,Sanderling,Sandwich- Tern,Arctic or Common Tern,Little- Tern,and all types of Gulls.
